title: Klopp Faces Tottenham Test
text:
Sports News | 15 October 2015 15:59 CET Klopp Faces Tottenham Test By Daily Guide 
Jurgen Klopp New Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp had the full complement of stars for the first time on Wednesday as he welcomed players back from international duty and stepped up preparations for the return of the Premier League. 
Former Borussia Dortmund coach Klopp was appointed as Brendan Rodgers’ replacement a week ago and will make his debut in the dugout on Saturday lunchtime. 
Klopp, who was pictured for the first time taking training at the club’s Melwood base, faces a visit to White Hart Lane to take on Tottenham and had only been able to work with a small group of players during the international break. 
But the 48-year-old began work on getting to know the rest of his squad as the German coach put them through their paces on Wednesday afternoon, three days ahead of clash. 
One player that is likely to remain unavailable to Klopp this weekend is summer signing Christian Benteke, who is struggling to shake off calf and hamstring injuries, but Roberto Firmino returned to training after recovering from a back complaint. 
Expectations at Anfield have risen dramatically since Klopp took charge. 
Klopp was boosted by the news on Wednesday that his assistant manager Zelko Buvac, who worked with the new Reds boss at Dortmund and Mainz in Germany, arrived in Liverpool to help with the session. 
Buvac's arrival had been given the green light after he was granted a work permit and he will be on the touchline for Saturday's Premier League clash at Tottenham. 
Having Buvac on board will be a significant boost for Klopp, who has been overseeing training since Monday with Peter Krawietz and Pep Lijnders.
